===Etymology===
{{ja-etym-buddhist}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=みょうおう}} {{m|ltc|明王|tr=*miæng *hiuɑng|lit=wisdom king}}, itself a translation of {{etyl|sa|ja|sort=みょうおう}} {{m|sa|विद्याराज|tr=vidyārāja||knowledge king}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR|みょうおう}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|みょうおう}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=みょうおう|religion|Buddhism}} a Wisdom King in [[w:Vajrayana|Vajrayana Buddhism]]
#: Also called a ''Guardian King''.
# {{lb|ja|sort=みょうおう|religion|Buddhism}} short for {{ja-l|五大明王||Go Dai Myōō}}, the Five Wisdom Kings
# {{lb|ja|sort=みょうおう|religion|Buddhism}} by extension, more specifically refers to {{ja-l|不動明王||Fudō Myōō}}, the central figure of the Five Wisdom Kings
# {{lb|ja|sort=みょうおう|rare}} a [[wise]] [[gentleman]]
